results.name: Triangular array read by rows: a(n,k) = Sum_{d|k} mu(d)*U(n,k/d)/n if k|n else 0, where U(n,k) = A047916(n,k) (1<=k<=n).
reference: J. E. A. Steggall, On the numbers of patterns which can be derived from certain elements, Mess. Math., 37 (1907), 56-61.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
C. L. Mallows and N. J. A. Sloane, Notes on A002618, A002619, etc.
N. J. A. Sloane, Notes on A002618, A002619, etc.
J. E. A. Steggall, On the numbers of patterns which can be derived from certain elements, Mess. Math., 37 (1907), 56-61.
J. E. A. Steggall, On the numbers of patterns which can be derived from certain elements, Mess. Math., 37 (1907), 56-61. [Annotated scanned copy. Note that the scanned pages are out of order]
mathematica: U[n_, k_] := If[Divisible[n, k], EulerPhi[n/k]*(n/k)^k*k!, 0]; a[n_, k_] := Sum[If[Divisible[n, k], MoebiusMu[d]*U[n, k/d], 0], {d, Divisors[k]}]; row[n_] := Table[a[n, k], {k, 1, n}]/n; Table[row[n], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 21 2012, after A047918 *)
xref: Divide n-th row of array A047918 by n.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
